org.digijava.kernel.util

Class ModuleUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digijava.kernel.util.ModuleUtils

  • public class ModuleUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains module-related utillity functions. Module must be identified only using module name (String)

      • getItemIdentityTypes

        public java.util.Set getItemIdentityTypes(java.lang.String moduleName)
        Returns set of all identity types, defined for module's actions
        Parameters:
        moduleName - String module name
        Returns:
        Set of identity types. Set is empty, if there are no identities defined

      • getModuleDefaultInstance

        Returns module default instance, defined in module-config.xml
        Parameters:
        moduleName - name of the module
        Returns:
        default instance name

        Throws:

      • getModuleInstance

        public static ModuleInstance getModuleInstance(java.lang.Long siteId,
                                               java.lang.String module,
                                               java.lang.String instance)
        Returns ModuleInstance object for given site, module and instance identities
        Parameters:
        siteId - String identity of site
        module - Name of the module
        instance - Name of the instance
        Returns:
        ModuleInstance

      • getSharedModuleInstance

        public static ModuleInstance getSharedModuleInstance(java.lang.String module,
                                                     java.lang.String instance)
        Returns Shared ModuleInstance object for module and instance identities. The module instance is "shared" if it does not have site assigned. In this case, this module instance exists on all sites. Examples are admin:default, um:user, exception:default, etc
        Parameters:
        module - Name of the module
        instance - Name of the instance
        Returns:
        ModuleInstance

      • isContentAdministrator

        public static boolean isContentAdministrator(javax.security.auth.Subject subject,
                                             Site currentSite,
                                             ModuleInstance moduleInstance)
        Returns true, if logged user has content administrator rights on the module instance or false if user does not have such rights.
        Parameters:
        subject - Authentication Subject
        currentSite - Site on which security check is performed
        moduleInstance - ModuleInstance
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isAdministrator

        public static boolean isAdministrator(javax.security.auth.Subject subject,
                                      Site currentSite,
                                      ModuleInstance moduleInstance)
        Returns true, if logged user has content administrator rights on the module instance or false if user does not have such rights.
        Parameters:
        subject - Authentication Subject
        currentSite - Site on which security check is performed
        moduleInstance - ModuleInstance
        Returns:
        boolean
